访问网站的条件
一般条款
本网站由樟宜机场集团授权访问。访问和使用本樟宜机场集团网站及其 Max 聊天机器人，即表明您已经阅读并同意所有条件和注意事项，且不得修改。如果您不同意本文中的任何条件，请立即停止访问。
所有权
本樟宜机场集团网站和 Max 聊天机器人由樟宜机场集团拥有和运营。访问和使用本樟宜机场集团网站和 Max 聊天机器人，以及所提供的信息和服务须遵守以下条件。
本樟宜机场集团网站和 Max 聊天机器人包含也由樟宜机场集团运营的网站的链接。您使用樟宜机场集团网站也受其中包含的访问条件（如有）的约束。如果此处的任何条件与樟宜机场集团运营的其他网站的任何条件相抵触，则在您访问/使用樟宜机场集团运营的其他网站时，将以这些其他网站的条件为准。
访问和使用限制
您可以在本樟宜机场集团网站下载一份材料的副本，但是只能在一台电脑上下载，并且只能用于您个人和非商业用途，前提是
1. 所有副本必须带有樟宜机场集团网站上的相关版权、商标和/或其他专有声明；以及
2. 未经樟宜机场集团书面许可，您不得修改、重新格式化、复制、重制、展示、分发、发布、传送、张贴、上传、授权、创建衍生作品、超链接、在任何信息检索系统中存储、以任何方式转让或出售任何材料。这意味着，除其他事项外，您不得在任何其他网站上插入本樟宜机场集团网站的超链接，也不得在您自己的网站上插入本樟宜机场集团网站或任何樟宜机场集团网站的主页或其他页面或其中的材料或其各自的链接的“镜像”。
您不得将本樟宜机场集团网站、其链接或 Max 聊天机器人用于任何违法、非法或这些访问条件禁止的目的。
樟宜机场集团保留在任何时候拒绝任何人访问本网站或任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人的权利，而无需通知或指定任何理由。
陈述和保证的免责声明
本樟宜机场集团网站、所有其他樟宜机场集团网站和 Max 聊天机器人上的内容或通过它们可以访问的内容（包括第三方信息、产品和/或服务）在提供时：
3. 是按“原样”、“现有”提供的，并可能随时更改，恕不另行通知您；并且
4. 不作任何明示或暗示的陈述或保证。
责任免除
在任何情况下，樟宜机场集团或其任何附属公司或子公司均不承担任何损害赔偿责任，包括但不限于任何直接、间接、特殊、后果性、惩罚性或附带损害赔偿，或因使用、无法使用、未经授权使用、履行或不履行或依赖本网站或任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人而导致或与之相关的使用、利润、数据或其他无形资产损失的损害赔偿，或替代商品或服务的采购成本，即使樟宜机场集团事先已被告知这种损害的可能性，以及无论这种损害是因合同、侵权、成文法、衡平法还是法律而产生。
指向第三方网站的链接
本网站或任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人所链接的网站可能由樟宜机场集团以外的其他方开发和/或运营。
樟宜机场集团并不控制该等网站，也不对其内容负责。樟宜机场集团提供这些网站的链接本身并不构成或暗示对这些网站上的材料的任何认可、赞助或推荐，或与其所有者和/或运营商的任何关联（除非另有明确说明）。
任何第三方如果希望建立本网站、任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人的链接，应事先以书面形式通知樟宜机场集团。樟宜机场集团保留拒绝任何此类链接许可的权利，而无需指定任何理由。如果获得许可，樟宜机场集团没有义务建立交互链接。
反馈
向樟宜机场集团提供的所有反馈（包括与本网站、樟宜机场集团任何其他网站或 Max 聊天机器人的内容相关的问题、意见、建议或类似内容）均应被视为非保密信息。樟宜机场集团可以出于任何目的自由使用上述反馈中包含的理念、概念、技术或知识。对于上述反馈，樟宜机场集团不承担任何义务，并且可以不受限制地复制、使用、披露和分发给其他方。
未颁发许可证
本网站、任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人上的任何内容或者您对它们的使用均不应被解释为授予樟宜机场集团、其附属公司或子公司的知识产权或专有权利项下的任何许可或其他权利，无论是通过禁止反悔、暗示还是其他方式。
使用条款的修改
樟宜机场集团保留在不发出通知的情况下随时修改上述访问条件的权利，并且您特此同意受此类修改的约束。
完整协议
这些访问条件构成您与樟宜机场集团之间的完整协议，您同意与您访问和使用本网站、任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人有关的任何和所有先前和同时的协议均被取代。
条款的可分割性
如果上述访问条件中的任何规定被确定为无效或不可执行，均不影响上述访问条件中的任何其他规定，这些规定应保持有效并可以执行。
适用法律和管辖区
这些访问条件受新加坡共和国法律管辖，并应根据新加坡共和国法律进行解释，包括但不限于《证据法案》（第 97 章）和《电子交易法案》（1998 年第 25 号），而不考虑法律规定的任何其他选择。
您在此不可撤销地接受新加坡共和国法院对与本网站、任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人的访问条件和/或使用有关的任何和所有争议的非专属管辖权。
根据樟宜机场集团的选择，对于由这些访问条件、本网站、樟宜机场集团运营的任何其他网站或 Max 聊天机器人引起的或与之相关的任何争议或分歧，应使用英语在新加坡提交并通过仲裁解决，并遵守当时生效的新加坡国际仲裁中心的仲裁规则，该规则被视为通过引用纳入本条款。
如果您所在的司法管辖区的法律不允许访问或限制访问本网站、任何其他樟宜机场集团网站或 Max 聊天机器人的内容，您应立即停止访问或遵守此类限制（视情况而定）。
Max 聊天机器人的使用条款
个人数据
使用 Max 聊天机器人，即表示您同意您在使用 Max 聊天机器人时提供给樟宜机场集团的个人数据将按照樟宜机场集团的隐私政策使用，用于提供、个性化和改进所提供的服务。我们的cookie 政策中规定了关于浏览器 cookie 和在本网站使用浏览器 cookie 的信息。我们之间通过 Max 聊天机器人用 Facebook Messenger 应用程序交换的任何消息也将被 Facebook（脸书） 根据 Facebook（脸书） 的数据政策进行收集和使用。
安全与第三方协议
您有责任确保您设备的物理安全，并维护您设备上信息的机密性，包括您的 Facebook Messenger 帐户、Telegram 帐户、Whatsapp 帐户或 Max 聊天机器人使用的任何此类消息平台（“帐户”）。您承认，任何与您共享您的设备或帐户凭证的人都能够看到您通过 Max 聊天机器人与樟宜机场集团交换的所有消息和信息，包括您通过相关帐户进行的对话记录。您同意，您自行承担使用 Max 聊天机器人的风险，并且您不应让樟宜机场集团负责承担您因使用 Max 聊天机器人而可能遭受的任何损失或损害，包括任何未经授权的信息访问。
帐户提供商和纳入帐户的或链接到 Max 聊天机器人或通过其链接的其他第三方服务或网站有自己的条款与条件，以及隐私政策和做法。您对 Max 聊天机器人的使用将受这些第三方协议的约束，或将允许这些第三方访问您的个人信息。您有责任在使用 Max 聊天机器人之前审查并接受适用的第三方协议。
注意事项
切记
1. 如果您发现机场内任何地方有可疑人员或活动，请致电+65 6546 0000联系机场警察。
2. 如有紧急医疗情况，请致电+656543 2223联系 Raffles Medical Group (RMG)（莱佛士医疗集团）
3. 如果在机场任何地方发现任何故障，请致电+656541 2424联系故障管理中心。
4. 如有火灾紧急情况，请致电+656541 2525联系机场紧急服务中心。
5. 只允许在机场内的指定区域吸烟。
6. 在公共区域进行的自助机场游览须经樟宜机场集团批准。欲了解更多信息，并寻求许可，请发送电子邮件至airport.tour@changiairport.com。所有申请都须经审批。
7. 如果您找到丢失的物品，请将其交给咨询柜台。
8. 对于任何商业拍摄和/或摄影，请将您的申请发送到filmphoto@changiairport.com。所有申请都须经审批。
禁止
1. 机场场区的任何部分，包括轻轨列车、停车场、道路系统和与地铁相连的桥梁，不得使用个性化运输工具，如悬浮滑板、独轮车和其他类似设备。
2. 机场场区的任何部分，包括轻轨列车、停车场、道路系统和与地铁相连的桥梁，不得使用自行驱动的运输工具，如自行车、踏板车、单排旱冰鞋或滚轮旱冰鞋和滑板。
3. 禁止在机场场区的任何地方用个人设备大声播放音乐。
4. 倒票活动属违法行为，违规者可被移交给机场警察。
5. 不允许留宿。
6. 在机场场区的任何地方，都不允许进行涉及人群聚集的活动，例如快闪、暴动和非法集会。违规者可能会被移交给机场警察。
7. 禁止在机场场区的任何地方进行赌博和押注活动。违规者可能会被移交给机场警察。
8. 禁止在机场场区的任何地方进行体育、游戏或娱乐活动，如飞盘、各种类型的球类和球拍类游戏、无人机和放风筝。
9. 如在机场场区的任何地方听到火警警报，请不要惊慌。请保持冷静，听从机场工作人员的指示。
10. 请勿将宠物带入机场公共区域，除非它们是：
(i) 为新加坡当局服务的犬只；
(ii) 陪同视障人士的导盲犬；或
(iii) 将乘坐航空器旅行或从航空器上卸下的动物。
获机场授权商准许携带任何动物进入机场的人士，不得让该动物玷污机场的任何地方，或对其他人造成滋扰或烦恼。

隐私政策
© 2025 樟宜机场
我们竭诚为您带来最佳体验
樟宜机场使用 Cookie 和其他创新技术，为您提供更加个性化的卓越体验。我们利用分析技术来了解网站使用情况，从而提升我们的服务。（changiairport.com 和合作伙伴提供的）营销技术有助于我们更有针对性地宣传我们的服务。如果您选择禁用 Cookie，那么仅使用基本功能可能会让您的体验降级。偏好可随时更改，并在将来生效。更多信息请参阅我们的隐私政策。

控制面板
我的奖励
退出
en
中文
了解我们如何使用信息以及您可以如何保护自己的隐私。
隐私政策
一般信息
我们是 Changi Airport Group (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.，负责樟宜机场集团（下称“樟宜机场集团”、“我们”、“我方”或“我们的”）的管理和运营。
保护您的个人数据对我们具有重要意义，本《隐私政策》（下称“政策”）介绍了樟宜机场集团如何收集、使用或处理您的个人数据。本政策还阐述了我们如何保护您的个人数据。使用我们的服务，您即保证您已阅读、理解并同意本政策。
1. 定义
在本政策中：
“樟宜机场集团”是指樟宜机场集团、其子公司以及相关公司（如 1967 年公司法规定），包括 Changi Travel Services Pte. Ltd（下称“CTS”）、E-Concierge Pte Ltd（下称“Sift&Pick”）和 Jewel Changi Airport Development Pte Ltd（下称“星耀樟宜”）。
“个人数据”是指有关个人的数据（无论真实与否），可从该数据或该数据与本组织已获取或可能获取的其他信息中识别出个人身份。
“处理”、“已处理”和“正在处理”是指对个人数据进行的相关操作或一系列操作，其中包括记录、保存、整理、改写或变更、检索、组合、传送、删除或销毁。
2. 本政策的范围
本政策适用于樟宜机场集团（无论个人数据是如何收集的）处理的所有个人数据。樟宜机场集团通过各种社交媒体网站、网站、应用程序、域或其他平台（统称“平台”）收集该等个人信息，包括但不限于下列渠道：
平台
网站

3. 樟宜机场集团收集的个人数据
如本《隐私政策》所述，樟宜机场集团将在其认为合理需要的情况下，向您和/或樟宜机场集团的其他成员和/或其他第三方收集您的个人数据。如果您不提供或无法提供该等个人数据，樟宜机场集团可能无法提供您需要的产品和/服务。
我们收集的与您有关的个人数据的示例包括：
身份和联系方式数据，例如您的姓名、地址、电话号码、出生日期、电子邮箱地址、国籍或居住地、国民身份证号码、护照号码、工作经历、教育背景、专业资格、职称及职能、机场通行证详细信息以及生物识别数据等；
通过个人数据得出的推论（包括通过樟宜机场集团的任何成员和/或其他第三方得出的推论），例如个人特点、喜好、习惯、消费模式、兴趣等。
财务和付款数据，例如您的银行帐户、信用卡/借记卡号码以及其他相关账单或付款信息；
商业信息，例如我们与您或贵组织和樟宜机场集团的合同关系中提供的信息，或您或贵组织自愿提供的信息，包括身份和联系方式数据；
索赔信息，包括在樟宜机场集团可能需要进行的任何调查中提供的任何个人数据，例如照片、陈述或录音等；
个人资料、使用情况和技术数据，例如平台密码、您接收樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）营销通信的偏好、您的沟通偏好、有关您如何使用平台的信息、IP 地址、登录数据、浏览器类型、版本和设备类型以及可能与樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）提供的产品和/或服务相关的、与您的偏好有关的任何其他个人数据。如欲详细了解我们使用的 Cookie 或类似技术，请查看我们的《Cookie 政策》；
物理访问数据，例如您游览樟宜机场或访问我们的办公场所和设施（无论是在新加坡樟宜机场还是其他地方）时提供的信息，或者我们的闭路电视（“CCTV”）设备捕捉到的信息；以及
出入境相关信息，例如您的护照、登机牌、航班信息和照片上的个人信息。
4. 我们如何收集您的个人数据
樟宜机场集团以各种各样的方式收集个人数据，其中包括下列方式：
直接互动。您可以通过填写表格、使用我们的客户界面接触点（例如我们的人工客户服务柜台和自助服务亭）或通过邮寄、电话、电子邮件、聊天机器人或其他方式向我们提供您的个人数据。
我们也可以通过其他方式直接收集个人数据，包括在：
您申请樟宜机场集团集团任何成员提供的任何产品或服务；
您注册并参加由樟宜机场集团任何成员提供的任何会籍；
您在平台上开设帐户；
您订阅樟宜机场集团任何成员提供的任何通信或出版物；
您要求樟宜机场集团任何成员向您发送营销信息；
您参加樟宜机场集团任何成员开展的竞赛、促销或调查；
您向我们提供反馈；
您在新加坡樟宜机场连接 WiFi；
您使用樟宜机场集团任何成员开发的或为其开发的移动或网络应用程序；或
您通过热门聊天平台（如 WhatsApp 和 Telegram）与我们或我们的聊天机器人沟通；或
我们在新加坡樟宜机场安装的摄像头拍到的或官方摄影师/摄像师在各种活动和节目中拍到的您的图像（包括录像）。
我们也可能从以下来源或通过以下方式收集您的个人数据：
第三方或公共渠道。我们可能会从各种第三方那里收到您的个人数据，包括樟宜机场集团的任何成员、我们的代理人或您的组织、航空公司、政府机构和公开来源（包括技术、支付和交付服务提供商提供的财务和交易数据）。如果您授权任何实体或其他各方向我们披露信息，我们也可能从他们那里收到个人数据。
自动化技术或互动。您与平台互动时，我们可自动收集有关您的设备、浏览行为和方式的技术数据。我们使用 cookie、服务器日志和其他类似技术收集此类数据。平台上的某些功能（如适用）需要上述技术才能运作。更多详情请参阅我们的《Cookie 政策》。如果您不想使用某些 cookie，您可以根据我们的《Cookie 政策》加以管理。
CCTV 系统或其他监控设备。樟宜机场集团或我们授权的第三方在新加坡樟宜机场安装了闭路电视系统和其他监控设备，这些设备可能会记录您的图像，用以：(i) 监控人员安保和安全；(ii) 协助调查犯罪和其他事件；(iii) 管理新加坡樟宜机场提供的服务。
5. 我们如何使用您的个人数据
樟宜机场集团成员竭力优化其运营以及通过不同渠道（包括平台）向您提供的产品和/或服务，例如提供相关的、个性化的内容，打造更顺畅、更愉悦的用户体验。为有效了解和满足您的需求，樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）可能会出于与其职能和活动相关的目的处理您的个人数据，包括以下任意一个或多个目的：
方便您前往机场的各个接触点；
向您提供服务和帮助我们开发、改善、运行和管理樟宜机场集团（或其任何成员）向您提供的服务，包括在平台上和通过平台提供的服务和 WiFi 服务；
帮助我们核实您的身份，以便处理和管理任何会员申请或注册；
向您发送樟宜机场集团任何成员的相关推广活动、优惠、机会、产品、福利和规划的通知以及营销信息；
开展市场营销活动，包括市场研究、客户分析、客户洞察和定向营销活动；
进行性能分析和统计数据分析，改善为您提供的服务，包括匹配和汇总您通过不同渠道提供的信息，以便了解宜机场集团（或其任何成员）如何更好地为您服务；
通知您宜机场集团（或其任何成员）的规划、政策、条款与条件的变更、平台更新和其他管理信息；
管理和开展樟宜机场集团任何成员规划、推广、活动和竞赛；
预防、侦查和调查安全事故或违规行为、犯罪（包括欺诈）以及分析和管理其他风险；
按照您的特殊偏好对平台和平台的内容进行个性化设置；
进行调查、问卷调查和请求反馈；
回应您的询问、请求、反馈和投诉；
为了推广和宣传，包括在樟宜机场集团任何成员组织、主办或参与的活动或工作中对参与者录像或拍照；
为了达到任何适用法律法规、可执行的政府请求或法庭命令的要求；
管理您或您的组织与樟宜机场集团签订的任何合同；
查找、预防或以其他方式解决与平台提供的服务相关的安全或技术问题；
管理您对我们的办公场所和设施（无论是在新加坡樟宜机场还是其他地方）的访问和使用；和/或
实现在收集您的信息时向您发出的数据保护和隐私通知中可能明确注明的其他目的。
6. 披露和传输您的个人数据
在实现本政策第 5 条说明的一个或多个目的的过程中，我们可能会向以下一个或多个第三方披露您的个人数据：
我们的代理人；
我们授权的服务提供商，例如市场营销伙伴和网络分析公司及其业务伙伴；
我们的审计师和专业顾问；
我们的业务合作伙伴；
我们的担保人和保险人；
执法机关；
政府机关；
航空公司运营商；
航空公司中转贵宾室运营商；
免税优惠；
任何适用法律法规、可执行的政府要求或法庭命令允许或要求予以披露的任何个人；和/或
樟宜机场集团的任何成员（包括 CTS、Sift&Pick 和星耀樟宜）。
为方便我们与您互动，我们可能需要将您的个人数据传输到新加坡境外。只有相关措施的保护力度与新加坡《2012 年个人数据保护法》相同，我们才会这样做。
7. 个人数据处理的法律依据
同意：我们将通过让您在表格上签名或在方框上打勾等方法或方式，征求您对个人数据处理的明确书面同意，除非适用的法律或法规另有规定。如您做出书面同意，您即声明您年满 16 岁且可以给出有效的同意。如您向我们提供他人（例如员工或儿童）的信息，您即声明您获得了有效的授权和同意，且必须确保相关他人同意本政策并了解其信息的使用方式。您可按照本政策说明的联系详情联系我们的数据保护官，随时撤销该同意。
根据您撤销同意的范围，您撤销该等同意可能导致我们无法向您提供相关服务，可能被视为您终止樟宜机场集团与您之间的任何协议。樟宜机场集团明确保留在该情况下的合法权利和补救方式。
未成年人：未满 16 岁者如未经父母或监护人同意向我们提供了个人数据，父母或监护人应当通过本政策中列出的联系方式与我们联系，删除相关个人数据。如我们获悉个人数据是向未满 16 岁者收集的且未经父母或监护人同意，我们将删除该个人数据以及我们为该个体开设的任何帐户。
合法利益：我们可能会出于合法利益处理您的个人数据，以方便您前往机场的各个接触点。根据适用法律的要求，我们进行了合法利益评估，确保我们的利益不会凌驾于您的权利之上。
8. 指向第三方网站的链接
我们可能在平台中提供指向第三方网站的链接。您使用该等第三方网站须遵守其隐私政策，我们不对这些政策概不负责。我们鼓励您阅读您浏览的其他网站的隐私政策。一旦离开平台，您应当在该等第三方各自的网站上查看其适用的隐私政策，确定他们将如何处理向您收集的信息。因为对于我们可能链接的其他网站的政策或您可能与他们分享的任何数据的使用，我们无法控制或承担责任，所以您浏览此类第三方网站需自负风险。
9. 保障您的个人数据的安全
我们将采取合理的技术和程序性措施保护您的个人数据，例如：
确保您在我方开设的任何个人帐户的访问权限由密码和用户名控制，且该密码和用户名只属于您；
在安全的服务器上存储您的个人数据；以及
基于“需要知道”原则限制个人数据的访问权限。
请注意，使用互联网和/或平台无法实现绝对安全，因此我们不能保证您通过平台发送或者向您发送的任何个人数据是安全或完整的。您承诺数据传输的风险由您承担。
10. 个人数据 – 访问和更正
请您确保我们收集的数据的准确性——您承诺您将提供准确和完整的个人数据，并不时更新向我方提供的该等个人数据。在向我方提供个人数据之前，您应当仔细检查您向我方提供的信息是否完整、准确。
您可按照本政策说明的联系方式联系我们，请求访问和/或更正我们持有的您的个人数据。所有访问和/或更正请求将在合理时间内得到处理，但我们按照任何适用法律或法规拒绝此类请求的除外。在某些情况下，您可以通过平台直接访问和更正您的个人信息。对于平台自助服务功能之外的请求，在受理您的请求之前，我们可能需要核实您的身份。为了进行核实，我们可能需要您提供支持性信息或文件资料。
对于平台自助服务功能之外的所有请求，我们可能会收取合理的费用来处理和受理您的请求。
11. 欧盟（“EU”）数据主体的其他权利
樟宜机场集团是在新加坡成立的公司。我们没有在欧盟设立实体。
然而，如果您是欧盟的数据主体，且您认为《通用数据保护条例》（EU 2016/679）（“GDPR”）适用于您向我方提供的数据，如果您想行使下列权利，您可以联系我们：
要求删除您的个人数据；
要求限制对您的个人数据的处理；
拒绝对您的个人数据进行处理；和/或
要求将您的个人数据传输至您或第三方。
在受理您的请求之前，我们可能会核实您的身份和诉求。
在 GDPR 适用的情况下，如果我们违反了任何适用法律或法规，您也有权向相关的欧盟监管机构投诉。
向我们提出的、行使以上权利的请求将在合理时间内得到处理，但我们按照任何适用法律或法规拒绝此类请求的除外。
12. 数据保留
当我们收集您个人数据的目的终止和/或我们无需再为了任何法律或商业目的继续保留您的个人数据时，我们将停止保留您的个人数据。
13. 未经请求的信息
如果您向我方提供了未经请求的个人数据，例如未经请求的电子邮件或留言板上的公开帖子，即表示您同意樟宜机场集团在我们认为合适的、不保密的情况上使用未经请求的个人数据，樟宜机场集团有权自由使用、披露、分发和利用该等未经请求的个人数据，不受限制，亦不注明出处。樟宜机场集团竭力采取合理措施销毁或识别对樟宜机场集团毫无用途的、未经请求的个人数据，但由于既定系统和操作限制，樟宜机场集团无法保证处理所有未经请求的个人数据。如果您不同意我们对您提供的未经请求的个人数据的处理方式，您有责任不向樟宜机场集团提供我们未向您索取的个人数据。
14. 本政策的变更
为反映我们处理个人数据方式的变更或法律要求的变动，我们可能会不时修改本政策（包括《Cookies 政策》）。未来本政策的变更都将在本页面上公布，我们会适当通过平台或其他通讯渠道通知您。如使用我们的服务，您承诺定期查看相关网站或平台版块是否更新。
15. 如何联系我们
我们欢迎您提供反馈、意见和提出任何可能出现的问题。
有关任何平台的具体问询，请通过上文第 2 节列出的电子邮箱/门户网站联系我们。
有关本政策或个人数据的相关事宜，请通过下面的地址致函，来函注明“隐私政策”：
Data Protection OfficerChangi Airport Group (Singapore) Pte. Ltd.60 Airport BoulevardChangi Airport Terminal 2, #04-08Singapore 819643
或发送电子邮件至 data.protection@changiairport.com 并提及“隐私政策”。
求职者、实习申请人或奖学金申请人，请参阅这里的隐私政策。
请点击这里，访问我们的《隐私政策》，了解企业责任。
更新日期 2024 月 12 月 30 日。

樟宜机场使用 Cookie 和其他创新技术，为您提供更加个性化的卓越体验。我们利用分析技术来了解网站使用情况，从而提升我们的服务。（changiairport.com 和合作伙伴提供的）营销技术有助于我们更有针对性地宣传我们的服务。如果您选择禁用 Cookie，那么仅使用基本功能可能会让您的体验降级。偏好可随时更改，并在将来生效。更多信息请参阅我们的隐私政策。

Celebrate SG60 with a charity walkathon, local performances, vibrant horticulture, and a dazzling outdoor light-up - fun for all!
Celebrate SG60 with a charity walkathon, local performances, vibrant horticulture, and a dazzling outdoor light-up - fun for all!
Join us in marking Singapore’s 60th with a charity walkathon, live performances by local talents, a stunning horticultural display, and a spectacularoutdoor light-up.
Celebrate this milestone with lively activities that everyone can enjoy!
Empower disadvantaged youths and children
Let the celebration begin! Discover fun-filled moments, special deals & rewards!
Limited-edition Changi Tower Popsicle by Creamier – now at Jewel, while stocks last!
[Coming Soon]: SG60 garden displays celebrate Singapore’s nature and Changi’s garden identity.
Be serenaded by headliners, Stefanie Sun, Kit Chan and more at SG60 Homecoming Concert.
[Coming soon]: Airport Boulevard will shine with iconic sights and a glowing SG60 arch!
Join us at ST3PS on 9 Aug 2025 for a mass-NDP watch party, goodie bags & more!
Join us at ST3PS on 9 Aug 2025 for a mass-NDP watch party, goodie bags & more!
Enjoy special SG60 promotions across shopping, dining, and more at Changi Airport
Spend S$20 minimum in a single same-day receipt at Hub & Spoke Café or Overflow Bar to redeem!
Play, explore, and have fun learning about Changi Airport with this great bundle deal!

© 2025 Changi Airport
Let’s give you the best experience possible
Changi Airport uses cookies and other innovative tech to deliver an incredible and more personalized experience. Analytical technologies give us insights on site usage to improve our services. Marketing technologies (from changiairport.com and trusted partners) help us advertise our services more relevantly. If you choose tokeep them off, the basic functionality may degrade your experience. Preferences can be changed at any time with future effect. For more information, see ourprivacy policy.

About
Charity Partner
LOCATION
Frequently Asked Questions
Terms & Conditions
A sweet way to make a real difference
Join Buddy and Mr Merlion on a delicious night walk down the glowing Changi Airport Connector (PCN) on 27 July. This fund-raising event is organised in support of Community Chest-funded programmes that empower children with special needs and youth-at-risk.Support our participants to raise funds for Community Chest by donating onGiving.sg.CAG will match eligible contributions dollar-for-dollar (up to S$60,000) via the Changi Foundation. Eligible donations will also be matched by SG Gives, turning every S$1 into S$4 for the Community Chest.
Get ready for a delicious adventure with Buddy and Mr Merlion as we stroll through the illuminated Changi Airport Park Connector this SG60, in search of our delightful local treats! Every step we take together helps raise funds for youth-at-risk and children with special needs, empowering them to chase their dreams.
Be dazzled by the special SG60 light-up as the park connector comes alive in a glow of colour and celebration on 27 July. Wander through a trail of illuminated fun, take on interactive trivia and mini-games, snap a photo with Mr. Merlion and Buddy Plus, you stand a chance to win amazing prizes in our Lucky Draw!
Sign up now to join us on this meaningful journey of supporting our nation's youths and children!
Exciting collectibles for all participants
Exciting collectibles for all participants
Exclusive Finisher Plush Keychain of Changi Buddy bear / Mr. Merlion (given at random) and Singapore Mint Finisher Medallion (exclusive for Charity Walk participants)
Exclusive Finisher Plush Keychain of Changi Buddy bear / Mr. Merlion (given at random) and Singapore Mint Finisher Medallion (exclusive for Charity Walk participants)
Charity Walk Route Overview
Charity Walk Route Overview
All proceeds raised from the event goes towards youth-at-risk and children with special needs programmes through Community Chest.
Community Chest, the philanthropy arm of the National Council of Social Service (NCSS) supports more than 200 critical social service programmes across 5 causes to meet underserved and critical social needs.
In support of the event, Changi Foundation will match the sum raised dollar-for-dollar, up to $60,000.
Community Chest
Community Chest
All proceeds raised will go towards youth-at-risk and children with special needs programs through SGSHARE, the national regular giving programme by Community Chest.
All proceeds raised will go towards youth-at-risk and children with special needs programs through SGSHARE, the national regular giving programme by Community Chest.
How to sign up?
You may registerhere
Is there a race pack?
Yes, there will be a race pack. More details will be available soon.
Is there a finisher entitlement?
Yes, a finisher plush keychain will be given to all finishers. There are 2 designs, Changi Buddy Bear (Merlion edition) and Mr. Merlion, which will be given at random.
Where will my contributions go?
Your contributions will go towards Youth- at- Risk and Children with Special Needs programs, through Community Chest.
Can I donate directly?
Yes, you can! Donations can be directly made to this event via the event registration pagehere.
Is this an outdoor event?
Yes, this event is held outdoors along the Changi Airport Park Connector. The route is mainly outdoors with sections under shelter.
Can children participate?
Yes, children are welcome to participate in the event with an accompanying adult. Simply sign up as a team of 2 (Buddy) or 4 (Team) via the registration pagehere.
Is there a bag drop?
No, there is no bag drop at the event. You are encouraged to have a small bag to contain your valuable items and dress light for a comfortable walk.
Can I cancel my registration?
All registrations are non-refundable and non-transferable. Any cancellation will be treated as no-show, no refunds will be allowed.
TERMS AND CONDITIONS
2.REGISTRATION2.1 By signing up for the Event, including but not limited to completion and submission of the online registration form, each participant of the Event (the “Participant”) acknowledges and agrees that the Terms and Conditions apply to his/her participation in the Event, and agrees to abide by the Terms and Conditions as amended from time to time. The Participant agrees that registration in the Event is personal to the Participant and is not transferable to any other person, nor will any other person be permitted to participate in the Participant’s place.2.2 The Participant declares as a condition of entry into the Event that:
(i) The Participant has undertaken appropriate and sufficient training for the Event;
(ii)  The Participant is not aware of any illness, injury, or physical disability that may cause or result in injury or death during or as a consequence of participating in the Event;
(iii)  The Participant shall keep himself/herself informed of and shall be responsible for assessing the dangers, hazards and other risks of taking part in the Event,   notwithstanding any actions or activities undertaken by the Organiser or its contractors in promoting, staging or marketing of the Event;
(iv) The Participant declares that he/she has provided true, accurate, current and complete information about himself/herself in the registration form (the "Registration Data") (online or otherwise) and agrees to maintain and promptly update the Registration Data to keep it true, accurate, current and complete if there are any changes after registration; and
(v) The Participant shall abide by all applicable laws in his/her participation in the Event.
2.3 The Participant declares that the decision to take part in the Event is entirely his/her own decision, and accepts all risks associated with participating in the Event, including but not limited to the loss of life and/or any injury, including but not limited to permanent injury.2.4 The Organiser reserves the right to remove the Participant if the Organiser determines in their sole opinion that the Participant is physically incapable of continuing with the walk to prevent him/her from causing greater harm or injury to himself/herself. In the event of an injury, accident or illness affecting or suffered by the Participant while taking part in or at the Event, the Participant consents to receiving emergency medical aid or preventive treatment as may be deemed necessary or advisable in the unfettered discretion of medical personnel attending or present at the Event.2.5 The Participant acknowledges and agrees that the Organiser and/or their representatives may refuse entry to, remove the Participant or require the Participant to leave from the Event and vicinity and/or exclude the Participant from participating in the Event and related activities without giving any reason. Without limiting the foregoing, the Organiser and their representatives may also take any of the aforementioned action if it is necessary or appropriate to do so in the Organiser’s and/or their representative’s sole opinion, (i) due to inappropriate, offensive, abusive or other disruptive behaviour by the Participant; (ii) to preserve property or prevent damage to property; (iii) to prevent injury to or for the safety of the Participant or other Participants and visitors to the Event; (iv) for medical, health or safety reasons; and/or (v) to prevent or stop unauthorised or illegal activities (such as but not limited to ambush marketing or protesting).
2.6 Where the Event is or would be adversely affected by conditions beyond the Organiser’s reasonable control as determined by the Organiser, such as inclement weather, or other hazardous conditions including but not limited to the outbreak of MERS, H1N1, COVID-19, etc. (based on advisories from the Ministry of Health) or haze (where the air quality pollutant standards index rises above the acceptable PM2.5 readings or based on advisories from the National Environment Agency), the Organiser reserves the right to delay the commencement of the Event, or cancel or postpone or reschedule the Event without any prior notification. The Organiser shall not be liable to any Participant in the event of such delay, cancellation, postponement or rescheduling of the Event, and shall not be obligated to refund registration fees.
2.7Purchasing of Event Ticket. Payment for the Event ticket can only be made via debit/credit card through the third-party payment service provider, “Stripe” (“Payment Method”). The Participant declares that he/she has provided a current, valid and accepted debit/credit card to use the service. The foregoing does not limit or waive the Organiser’s rights to seek payment directly from the Participant through any other method, should the Payment Method fail. The Participant may edit his/her debit/credit card information by contacting Stripe atinfo@stripe.com.If payment is not successful, due to expiration, insufficient funds, or otherwise, and the Participant does not edit his/her debit/credit card information or cancel his/her account, the Participant remains responsible for any unpaid purchases or fees and authorises the Organiser to continue billing with the Payment Method. This may result in a change to the Participant’s payment billing dateThe terms of the Participant’s payment will be based on his/her debit/credit card and may be determined by agreement between the Participant and his/her financial institution, or other credit/debit card issuer. The Organiser disclaims all liabilities associated with the security of the Payment Method. Participants shall be responsible to resolve any disputes with his/her financial institution, credit/debit card issuer or provider.
2.8 The Participant agrees that the fees and costs of the Event ticket shall be subject to all prevailing statutory taxes, duties, fees, and/or charges (including but not limited to sales and goods and services taxes) (“Taxes”), wherever applicable, as may be in force at the relevant time. If any such Taxes are denominated in a foreign currency that is different to the currency in which the fees and costs of the Event ticket is charged (“Local Currency”), such foreign currency may be converted to the Local Currency by the Organiser or the Payment Method. The Participant further agrees to use his/her best efforts to do everything necessary and required by the relevant laws to enable, assist and/or defend the Organiser to claim or verify any input tax credit, set off, rebate or refund in respect of any taxes paid or payable in connection with the service.
2.9 The Participant’s registration for the Event is only confirmed upon successful payment and issuance of a confirmation email. The Event is strictly non-refundable and the Participant.
2.10 Once the registration form for the Event has been duly processed and accepted, there will be no refund of registration fees even if the Participant fails, for whatever reason, to take part in the Event. The Organiser will only process and accept duly completed online registration forms through the designated Official Website. It is the responsibility of the Participant to check that he/she has duly completed and submitted the online registration form and to check that such registration has been accepted by the Organiser. The Organiser will not be responsible for incomplete entry details or failure to process and accept the Participant’s registration form.
2.11 The Organiser reserves the right to suspend or terminate the Participant’s  compensation to him/her and/or prevent him/her access to the Event account if he/her is found to have repeatedly violated the Terms and Conditions.
2.12 The Organiser reserves the right to cancel or postpone the Event, or to modify any part of the Event, including the date, course and/or location, at any time without prior personal notice to the Participant. In the event of such cancellation, postponement or modification, the Organiser will post the details of cancellation, postponement or modification on the Official Website, and may inform the Participant prior to the date of the Event. If the Event is cancelled or postponed or modified, there shall be no refund of registration fees paid unless otherwise determined by the Organiser in their sole discretion, and the cancelled or postponed Event may not be rescheduled, and the Organiser shall not be liable for any loss or inconvenience caused.
2.13 Each Participant certifies that he/she is 18 years of age or older at the time of registration for the Event. If a Participant is below 18 years of age, the Participant must seek the consent of his/her parent or guardian before registering and participating in the Event, and in such an instance, the parent or guardian of the Participant certifies that he/she has read and fully understands, and agrees to these Terms and Conditions for and on behalf of the Participant.
2.14 Each participant must have one Event account in order to register for the Event (i.e., each runner must have an account to register for the Event). Any Participant who creates multiple accounts with single identity or multiple identities shall be in violation of these Terms and Conditions and shall have his/her account(s) suspended or terminated and shall not be allowed to have access to the Event account upon such suspension or termination. The Organiser has the right to review and investigate all allegations of fraudulent or unauthorised activities and to take all measures deemed necessary to ensure a fair sign-up scheme is implemented accordingly.3.EVENT CATEGORIES
3.1 The Event will have the following participation categories:
(i)  Charity Walk on 27 July 2025; and
(ii) Virtual Run Fundraising Challenge from 1 July 2025 to 31 August 2025.For the purposes of these Terms and Conditions, unless otherwise stated, references to the “Event” shall refer to either or both the Charity Walk and the Virtual Run Fundraising Challenge, as applicable to the context.
3.2 A Participant who has registered for the on-site Charity Walk agrees to follow the designated route, observe traffic rules and obey all directions and instructions given by the Event officials, Organiser’s security, the Singapore Police Force, and any other official personnel for the Event.
3.3 The Organiser reserves the right to delay the commencement of the Event or any part thereof in the event of inclement weather, or other hazardous conditions, prior to or on the Event day. In the event that inclement weather or other hazardous conditions persist, the Organiser reserves the right to reschedule or cancel the walk without any refund of registration fees.
3.4 No animals, or any form of wheel-run objects of transport (such as but not limited to inline skates, prams, push cars, shoes with built-in or attached rollers, handcycles, electronic scooters, geared vehicles, bicycles, or skateboards), balls or other accessories that may cause injury, are allowed on the designated course during the walk except for official walk and medical vehicles.
3.5 No baggage deposit services will be provided on the day of the Charity Walk Event. The Participants are advised not to bring any personal belongings to the walk on the day of the Event. The Organiser shall not be responsible nor have any liability for any loss or damage to the Participant’s belongings that are brought by or left by the Participant in the vicinity of the walk and/or Event space.
3.6 No drones or any other type of flying objects will be permitted at the Event without the prior written consent of the Organiser.
3.7 The Organiser reserves the right to inspect any bag, electronics, attachments or accessory of the Participant at any time during the Event, including at the starting or finish lines.
3.8 A Participant who has registered for the Virtual Run Fundraising Challenge agrees to complete a cumulative distance of 60 kilometres (60KM), which may be achieved through multiple running sessions, at any time and location, before 31 August 2025. Participants must track their runs using approved GPS-based fitness applications or may submit treadmill run data. Proof of completion including relevant distance, time, and route information must be uploaded to the Official Website for manual verification by the Organisers by 31 August 2025. Participants are solely responsible for their own safety during the activity and must comply with all traffic rules, laws, and local guidelines for safe path usage. The Organisers shall not be liable for any personal injury, loss, or damage arising from or in connection with participation in the Virtual Run Fundraising Challenge. Further details on approved GPS application usage are set out in Clause 12 (GPS APP AND USAGE).
4.FUNDRAISING
4.1 All proceeds from the registration fees for the Event will be donated to our Charity Partner, after deduction of all taxes, payment gateway fees and administration fees. All funds raised will go towards helping youths at risk and children with special needs programs through our Charity Partner.
4.2 By purchasing a ticket to the Event, Participants acknowledge and consent that the funds raised will be transferred to the Charity Partner after the conclusion of the Event.
4.3 All individual and corporate donations will collectively count towards the overall funds raised for the Event.
4.4 Where applicable, individual and corporate donations will receive the tax-deductible documentation directly via the donation site on Giving.sg.5.1 PROMOTION CODES & REFERRALS
5.1  Any promotion code used for the Event (“Promo Code”) is not transferable, exchangeable, convertible or redeemable for cash.
5.2 The Promo Code cannot be combined or accumulated with other offers or promotion codes.
5.3 The Promo Code may only be used pursuant to the specific terms that the Organiser has established for such promo code, in marketing websites or collateral that the Organiser may provide to the Participant. A Participant must enter the Promo Code into the “Promo Code” field prior to completing the order for the purchase of the Event ticket in order to use the Promo Code.
5.4 There is no limitation on the number of referrals that the Participant can make. The Participant can refer as many friends as he/she like if the referral policy is still in effect.
5.5 The Organiser reserves the right to withhold, deduct or remove credits or other features or benefits obtained using a Promo Code by the Participant or any other user if the Organiser determines or believes that the use or redemption of the Promo Code was in error, fraudulent, illegal or in violation of the applicable promotion code terms or these Terms and Conditions.
5.6 The Organiser reserves the right to change, suspend, cancel and/or waive the Promo Code and its applicable terms at the Organiser’s sole and absolute discretion without notice or liability to the Participant.
5.7 The Organiser may offer promotional offers or discounts with different features and different rates at their sole and absolute discretion to different Participants or groups of Participants. Each Participant agrees that such promotional offers or discounts, unless also made available to him/her, shall have no bearing on his/her participation in the Event.6.LUCKY DRAW
6.1  The Lucky Draw (“Draw”) is organised by the Organiser in conjunction with the Charity Walk. The Draw is open to all Participants of the Charity Walk who complete the full walk route on 25 July 2025.
6.2 To qualify for entry, Participants must scan the designated code shown on the Official Website at the end of the walk. Scanning the code will automatically enter the Participant into the Draw. No additional payment is required to participate in the Draw.
6.3 A total of 10 winners will be randomly selected after the completion of the Charity Walk Event on 25 July 2025. The winners will be announced on the same day. Winners will be notified via email or telephone (based on the details provided at registration) within 7 calendar days of the results. Event prizes are to be self-collected / self-arranged via courier. If a winner does not respond within 7 days of being notified, his/her prize will be forfeited.
6.4 Prizes are non-exchangeable, non-transferable and no cash alternative is offered. The Organiser reserves the right to replace, at their sole discretion, a prize with an alternative prize of equal or higher value.
6.5 The Organiser reserves the right to replace any Draw winner if he/she is disqualified or subsequently disqualified from the Event and/or Draw.
6.6 The Organiser’s decision on all matters relating to the Draw, including eligibility and the selection of winners, is final. No correspondence or appeals shall be entertained in relation thereto.
6.7 The Organiser may change these terms under this Clause 6, suspend, or terminate the Draw without giving prior notice.7.DECISIONS OF ORGANISER FINAL
7.1 The Organiser has the sole and absolute discretion to make any decision regarding the Event and shall have no obligation to provide any reasons. A Participant who takes part in the Event shall be deemed to have agreed and acknowledged that the decisions of the Organiser is final and binding on him/her. The Organiser will not consider any appeal nor enter into any correspondence with any Participant.8. SAFETY AND MEDICAL
8.1 Participants are strongly encouraged to go for a medical examination and/or consult their medical practitioner prior to completing the online registration, and also before and during the clock-in period/walk day.
8.2 Participants are advised against the consumption of alcohol or stimulants or any kind of drugs within 24 hours before participating the Charity Walk Event.9.NO LIABILITY
9.1 Each Participant is responsible for his/her involvement in the Event. Each Participant acknowledges that their participation in the Event may be physically demanding and may involve a certain amount of risk and in choosing to participate, the Participant acknowledges that he/she accepts all risks associated with participation in the Event and that such acceptance is a precondition to their participation. Each Participant understands that he/she will have to co-operate fully with the Organiser and diligently comply with all safety instructions, directions and requirements. To the maximum extent permitted by law, the Organiser, the Charity Partner, the sponsors, partners and their respective subsidiaries and affiliates, and the officers, directors, employees, contractors, agents, representatives, successors, assignees, and insurers of such entities shall not be liable for any claim, loss, damage, expense or liability that may arise out of the Participant’s death or injury, mishaps, or sickness, and/or any loss or damage of any description (including but not limited to loss or damage to personal property) that may be suffered or sustained as a result of or in connection with the Participant’s participation in the Event. In no event will the Organiser, the Charity Partner, the sponsors, partners and their respective subsidiaries and affiliates, and the officers, directors, employees, contractors, agents, representatives, successors, assignees and insurers of such entities be liable for any indirect, consequential, special or incidental loss, damage, expense or liability regardless of the form of action, whether in contract or tort (including negligence) arising from or in connection with the Participant’s participation in the Event.
9.2 By participating in the Event, each Participant hereby agrees, to the fullest extent permitted by law, to release and waive any and all claims against the Organiser, the Charity Partner, the sponsors, partners and their respective subsidiaries and affiliates, and the officers, directors, employees, contractors, agents, representatives, successors, assignees, and insurers of such entities that may arise from or in connection with the Participant’s participation in the Event.10.INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
10.1 All content and materials displayed on the Official Website including but not limited to logos, trademarks, text, graphics, photographs, videos, and software are the property of the Organiser or its licensors and are protected by applicable intellectual property laws.
10.2 No part of the website or its content may be copied, reproduced, republished, uploaded, posted, transmitted, or distributed in any way without prior written consent from the Organiser.10.3 Participants may not use the Event name, branding, or associated media for commercial or promotional purposes without express permission of the Organiser.
10.4 By submitting any content (including run data, photos, or testimonials) to the Official Website, participants grant the Organiser a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide licence to use, reproduce, and publish such content for promotional, reporting, or archival purposes related to the Event.
11.DISCLAIMERS ON THE USE OF THE OFFICIAL WEBSITE
11.1  While the Organiser and their contractors endeavour to ensure that the information and materials on the Event and Official Website are correct, no representation, warranty or guarantee, express or implied, is given that they are complete, accurate, up-to-date, reliable or fit for the purposes for which they are intended. To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Organiser and their contractors do not accept any liability for any errors or omissions or incompleteness, or inaccuracies in the information or materials. The information and materials on the Event are provided to the Participant for information purposes only and on an “as is” and “as available” basis without representations, warranties or guarantees of any kind either express or implied.
11.2 The Organiser makes no representation, warranty or guarantee:
(i) That the Official Website is appropriate or available for use in all countries or that the content complies with the laws of all countries. The Participant is responsible for ensuring that his/her access to and use of the Official Website is not illegal or prohibited by and complies with, the laws of the jurisdiction in which he/she is accessing the Official Website;
(ii) That the Official Website will be compatible with all hardware, software and operating system which the Participant may use; and/or
(iii) About the quality, suitability, safety or reliability of the Organiser or its contractor’s services.
11.3 While the Organiser and their contractors endeavour to make the Official Website available 24 hours a day, the Organiser and their contractors make no representation, warranty or guarantee that the Participant’s access to the Official Website will be uninterrupted, timely or error-free. The Organiser or their contractors may carry out repairs, maintenance or introduce new facilities and functions from time to time, which may cause interruptions or other downtimes in the Participant’s access to the Official Website. To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Organiser and their contractors disclaim all representations and warranties, whether express or implied, statutory or otherwise, and shall not be liable to any person if for any reason the Official Website is unavailable for any time or for any period, or if the use or access of the Official Website is interrupted or is performing slowly, or for any errors in or omission from, any information made available through the Official Website.
11.4 To the fullest extent permitted by law, the Organiser and their contractors shall not be liable to the Participant or any other person for any damage, claim, liability, expense or cost, arising out of or in connection with:
(i) Any person’s access and/or use of the Official Website and/or Event account using the Participant’s username and/or login password;
(ii) Any exposure to malicious software including but not limited to, viruses, computer worms, Trojan horses, spyware or other harmful forms of interference which may damage the Participant’s computer system, mobile device, software, data or other property or that may expose him/her to fraud when he/she accesses or uses the Official Website and/or the Event account. For the avoidance of doubt, the Participant shall be responsible for installing and maintaining all necessary anti-virus or other anti-malicious software and taking other necessary precautions to ensure the safety and integrity of the process by which he/she accesses and uses the Official Website and/or the Event account from such malware; and/or
(iii) Any site linked from the Official Website and/or the Event account. Any link on the Official Website and/or the Event account to other sites does not imply any endorsement, approval or recommendation of, or responsibility for, those sites or their contents, operations, products or operators.
12.GPS APP AND USAGE
12.1 For non-treadmill results that are submitted to the Organiser for the Virtual Run Fundraising Challenge, the Participant must submit the results via designated GPS-based mobile apps used to track athletic activity via satellite navigation and then upload and share such activities. The compatible GPS-enabled apps to clock the running distance, time, and route for the run are STRAVA and GARMIN. If a Participant uses other GPS- enabled apps, the Participant may need to manually upload the information onto the  Website. The Organiser reserves the right to reject any such manually uploaded data if they have reasonable grounds to believe that the data has been tampered with or altered.
12.2 As with any GPS app or mobile data device, the accuracy of the location information shown on the tracking panel depends on, amongst other things, the quality of the connection between the Participant’s device and the GPS satellites and the connection with the mobile phone network. These can be affected by environmental factors such as bad weather or the presence of tall buildings and information can be delayed, corrupted or lost. The information on the tracking panel is therefore to be regarded as being a guide to the location of the device at the time of the last update received from it and is subject to error. The use of the device and any of the GPS exercise tracking apps will be the responsibility of the Participant, and at the Participant’s own risk. The Organiser does not take any responsibility for the use of the device nor any GPS exercise tracking app, nor for any injury or death that may be caused to the Participant from such use. The usage of GPS routes is to showcase the distance completed by the Participant based on results submitted to ensure fair play among all Participants. If at any time the Organiser believes that a Participant has breached the Terms and Conditions or the terms of any other agreement with them or are using the Participant’s device and the GPS exercise tracking app in an improper or illegal manner or otherwise in a manner as to materially adversely affect the Official Website and/or Event account, the Organiser may immediately terminate or suspend the Participant’s use of the Event account and/or Official Website without notice.
12.3 For treadmill results, the Participant must manually submit their results via the Official Website, accompanied by clear and accurate photo evidence in accordance with the submission guidelines. The Organiser reserves the right to reject any manually submitted data if there are reasonable grounds to believe that the data is incomplete, inaccurate, tampered with, or otherwise does not comply with the stated guidelines.13.PRIVACY
13.1 By continuing to use the Organiser's services relating to the Event, accessing any part of the Official Website, registering for the Event, submitting information to the Organiser (and/ or its related entities) whether for the purpose of registering for the Event, donating or otherwise in relation to the Event, and in addition to the personal data protection consent having been executed by the Participant, the Participant expressly agrees and consents to the Organiser's (including its related entities, as well as their respective agents') collection, use and disclosure of his/her personal data for all and any purposes relating to the Event (“Purposes”), including but not limited to the following:
(i) to collect, analyse, collate, share, disclose to third parties, and/or otherwise use without any liability to the individual, any personal information relating to that Participant as the Organiser may in its sole discretion deem fit, including without any limitation, for Event registration, payment services, facilitating assistance, management and follow up, and for its programmes, planning, data- processing, and statistical or risk-analysis, research, fund-raising and/or any other purposes relating to the Event;(ii) to post the race results on the Official Website of the Organiser or on all and any other physical or electronic media whatsoever, now known or later developed; and(iii) to use any photographs, motion pictures, recordings, or any other records of the Event and of the Participants, Participants' supporters, sponsors, volunteers, and partners (“Participant Media”), for any legitimate purpose, including commercial advertising and distribution to Event sponsors.
The Participant acknowledges that the Organiser’s handling of personal data shall be governed by itsPrivacy Policy, which forms part of these Terms and Conditions.
13.4 The Organiser may disclose the Participant’s Personal Data to third-party service providers or agents involved in the Event (whether in Singapore or elsewhere in the world where such service providers are sited), for one or more of the above Purposes.
13.5 The Organiser may contact the Participant from time to time by postal mail, electronic transmission to the Participant’s email address, and/or by phone call, text messages (SMS and mms) and/or by fax.
13.6 The Participant’s consent extends to the Participant’s GPS activity course and segment maps, derived from the GPS-based mobile apps and Garmin wearable devices, uploaded upon run submissions by the Participant. These will only be used for the purpose of verifying the Participant’s run. The Participant is responsible for his/her election whether to share his/her GPS-based segment map on the Website’s social “Feed” in view of other users.
13.7 In providing or otherwise making available any Participant Media to the Organiser, the Participant hereby confirms and agrees as follows:
(i) That the Participant hereby grants to the Organiser, a royalty free, worldwide, irrevocable, perpetual license to reproduce, adapt, make derivative works, distribute, publicly display, transmit, communicate, and publish the Participant Media, and to sub-license third parties to do so (collectively, “Use”);
(ii) That the Participant has the full rights, capacity, standing and authorisation to grant the foregoing license and permission to the Organiser;
(iii) That the Participant and/or all other natural persons who are featured or who are otherwise identifiable in the Participant Media consent, without any compensation, to Use of the Participant Media by the Organizer and any other parties permitted by the Organiser, for all and any lawful purposes, including publicity, marketing, administration, and reporting;
(iv) That the Participant shall indemnify the Organiser and hold the Organiser harmless for any loss, damage or expense (including legal fees incurred by the Organiser on a solicitor-client basis) that may be suffered or incurred by the Organiser as a result of the Participant's breach of the foregoing; and
(v)The Organiser is not obliged to use the Participant Media.
14.GENERAL
14.1 The Organiser may contact the Participant (if needed) by email or by posting a notice on the Official Website. Notices will be deemed given 48 hours after the email is sent or notice is posted on the Official Website. The Participant agrees that this satisfies all legal requirements in relation to written communications.
14.2 The Terms and Conditions are governed by and shall be construed in accordance with Singapore laws and each Participant agrees to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Singapore courts.
14.3 Any cause of action arising out of or in connection with the Terms and Conditions or the Event must commence within 1 year after the cause of action accrues. Otherwise, such cause of action shall be permanently barred.
14.4 A waiver of any provision or rights under the Terms and Conditions by the Organiser must be in writing signed by the authorised representatives of the Organiser.
14.5 Clauses which, by their nature, are intended to survive termination or expiry of these Terms, including Clauses 2, 4, 7, 9, 10, 11, 13 and 14 shall continue in force.
14.6 If any provision of the Terms and Conditions is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, unenforceable, or invalid in any jurisdiction, that provision shall be deemed to be modified to the extent required to remedy the illegality, unenforceability or invalidity. If a modification is not possible, the provision shall be treated for all purposes as severed from the Terms and Conditions. The remainder of the Terms and Conditions shall remain in full force and effect and continue to be binding and enforceable on you.
14.7 The Participant may not assign the benefits and rights under the Terms and Conditions without the Organiser’s prior written approval. The Organiser may assign the benefits, rights and liabilities under the Terms and Conditions without the Participant’s consent to (i) their respective subsidiaries or related/affiliated companies; (ii) an acquirer of his/her equity, business or assets; or (iii) a successor by merger. No joint venture, partnership, employment, or agency relationship exists or shall arise between the Participant and the Organiser as a result of the Terms and Conditions.
14.8 If the Participant has any questions regarding the Terms and Conditions, please email the questions tocontact@42Race.com.
DATA PROTECTION NOTICE
This Data Protection Notice (“Notice”) sets out the terms upon which the Organisers and 42Race may collect, use, disclose, store or otherwise process the Personal Data of a Participant in accordance with the Personal Data Protection Act (“PDPA”). This Notice applies to Personal Data in the possession or control of the Organisers and 42Race, including Personal Data in the possession of persons that are engaged to collect, use, disclosing, process or storing Personal Data for the Organisers’ and 42Race ‘s Purposes (as defined below).
1. As used in this Notice,
(i) “Event”means the SG60 CHANGI AIRPORT CHARITY WALK co-organised by Changi Airport Group (Singapore) Pte Ltd (“CAG”), Changi Foundation (“Changi Foundation”),Goldwood Pte. Ltd. (“Goldwood”), and 42Technology Pte Ltd (“42Race”);(ii) “Participant” means an individual who has set up an account on the Platform and/or who has registered to take part in the Event.(iii) “Personal Data” means data, whether true or not, about an individual who can be identified:
(a) from the data; or
(b) from that data and other information, to which the Organisers and 42Race have or are likely to have access.
(iv)“Platform” means the third-party mobile application that is managed by 42Technology PteLtd (“42Race”), that is used to facilitate the run.(v) “Purposes” means the purposes for which Personal Data is collected, used, disclosed, processed and stored in connection with the Event as set out in paragraph 3 below.
2. By setting up an account on the Platform, registering and/or participating in the Event, the Participant acknowledges and consents to the privacy statements below and to the collection, use, disclosure, processing and storing of the Participant’s Personal Data as set out below.
3. The Organisers and 42Race and/or a third-party designated by the Organisers or 42Race will collect, use, disclose, process and/or store the Participant’s Personal Data (including information provided in the registration form) provided by the Participant, or from other sources for the purposes of processing and managing the Participant’s registration and participation in the Event, including but not limited to:
(i) performing obligations in the course of or in connection with the provision of goods and/or services requested by the Participant such as the delivery of the Event Bags and prizes to the Participant;
(ii) verifying the identity of the Participant, and responding to, handling, and processing queries, requests, applications, complaints, and feedback from the Participant;(iii) maintaining safety and security of the Event;
(iv) facilitating the provision of support and assistance relating to the health and well-being of the Participant and others;(v) processing payment transactions;
(vi) taking of photographs and videos during the Event for publicity and communications purposes;
(vii) outreach and engagement to garner philanthropic support for CAG;
(viii) sharing run submissions and journal entries or other social media postings of the Participant on the Organisers’ and 42Race’s social media and ‘feed’, which may be visible and viewedby the public in general, and which may be further downloaded and shared or re-shared by other users of the Platform or social media; and
(ix) responding to requests for information from public agencies, ministries, statutory boards, police, or other similar authorities (including but not limited to the Ministry of Defence, Ministry of Education and Ministry of Health) or other non-government agencies authorised to carry out specific Government services or duties from time to time.
4. The Organisers and 42Race may disclose the Participant’s Personal Data to third-party service providers or agents involved in the Event (whether in Singapore or elsewhere in the world where such service providers are sited), for one or more of the above Purposes.5. The Organisers and 42Race may contact the Participant from time to time by postal mail, electronic transmission to the Participant’s email address, and/or by phone call, text messages (SMS and mms) and/or by fax.
6. The Organisers and 42Race may continue to collect, use, disclose, process and store the Participant’s Personal Data for a reasonable period after the Event for the Purposes, including such period as to permit the Organisers and/or 42Race to enforce their rights under any contract.
7. The Participant consents to the Organisers’ and 42Race’s use and publication for the Purposes, without compensation or other payment to the Participant, of any photographs, motion pictures,recordings, or any other records of the Event that may contain the Participant’s image, voice, orstatement, and to the use and publication of the Participant’s name and race result in any form ofmedia (including but not limited to the Official Website, newspapers, news media websites, social media platforms (such as tiktok, Instagram, twitter, facebook, weibo, etc).
8. The Participant’s consent extends to the Participant’s GPS activity course and segment maps, derived from the GPS-based mobile apps and Garmin wearable devices, uploaded upon run submissions by the Participant. These will only be used for the purpose of verifying the Participant’s run. The Participant is responsible for his/her election whether to share his/her GPS-based segment map on the Platform’s social “Feed” in view of other users.
1. WITHDRAWING CONSENT
1.1 The Participant’s consent to the collection, use, disclosure, processing and storage of his/her Personal Data shall remain valid until such time that the consent is withdrawn by him/her in writing. The Participant may withdraw consent by submitting a request in writing via email to theData Protection Officer of the Organisers and 42Race at the contact details provided below, thathe/she is withdrawing his/her consent and to stop using and/or disclosing his/her Personal Data for any or all of the Purposes listed above.
1.2 Upon receipt of the Participant’s written request to withdraw his/her consent, the Organisers and 42Race will require a reasonable time (not less than 10 Business Days) to process the request.
1.3 Depending on the nature and scope of the Participant’s withdrawal of consent, the Organisers’ and 42Race may not be in a position to continue providing goods and/or services to the Participant. Without limiting the foregoing, a withdrawal of the Participant’s consent to the collection, use, disclosure, processing and storing of the Participant’s Personal Data will result in a termination of the Participant’s registration and participation in the Event.
2. ACCESS TO AND CORRECTION OF PERSONAL DATA
2.1 If the Participant wishes to make (a) an access request to access a copy of his/her Personal Data, or (b) a correction request to correct or update any of his/her Personal Data, held by the Organisers and 42Race, the Participant must submit a request in writing or via email to the Organisers’ and 42Race’s Data Protection Officer at the contact details provided below.
2.2 A reasonable fee may be charged for an access request. If so, the Organisers and/or 42Race (as the case may be) will inform the Participant of the fee before processing his/her request.
2.3 The Organisers and 42Race will respond to the Participant’s request as soon as reasonably practicable.
3. PROTECTION OF PERSONAL DATA
3.1 The Participant agrees that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is completely secure. While security cannot be guaranteed, the Organisers and 42Racewill take commercially reasonable steps to protect the security of the Participant’s PersonalData.
4. ACCURACY OF PERSONAL DATA
4.1 The Organisers and 42Race generally rely on the Personal Data provided by the Participant (or his/her authorised representative). In order to ensure that the Participant’s Personal Data is current, complete and accurate, the Participant is required to update the Organisers and 42Race if there are changes to his/her Personal Data by submitting his/her request in writing or via email to the Data Protection Officers at the contact details provided below.
4.2 If the Participant provides any Personal Data or information that is untrue, inaccurate, not current or incomplete, or if the Organisers and 42Race have grounds to suspect that such Personal Data or information is untrue, inaccurate, not current or incomplete, the Organisers and 42Race may suspend or terminate the Participant’s registration and participation on the Platform and in the Event, and/or refuse any and all future use of the Official Website and the Platform.
5. RETENTION OF PERSONAL DATA
5.1 The Organisers and 42Race may retain the Participant’s Personal Data for as long as it is necessary to fulfil the purposes for which it was collected, or as required or permitted by applicable laws, and will cease to retain the Participant’s Personal Data in accordance with laws.
6. TRANSFERS OF PERSONAL DATA OUTSIDE OF SINGAPORE
6.1 The Participant acknowledges and consents to the Organisers and/or 42Race transferring the Participant’s Personal Data out of Singapore to their third-party service providers or agents for the Purposes.
7. DATA PROTECTION OFFICER7.1 The Participant may contact the Organisers’ and 42Race ‘s Data Protection Officers at the following contact details if he/she has any enquiries or feedback on the respective personal data protection policies and procedures of the Organisers and 42Race, or if he/she wishes to make any request:
42Technology Pte Ltd
To:The Data Protection Officer
Name:Augustine Chua
Email:dpo@42race.com
8.  EFFECT OF NOTICE AND CHANGES TO NOTICE8.1 The Organisers and 42Race may revise this Notice from time to time without any prior notice to the Participant. The Participant is advised to check for updates to this Notice from time to time onthe Official Website. The Participant’s continued use of the Platform and other services of the Organisers and/or 42Race, and his/her continued participation in the Event shall constitute his/her acknowledgement and acceptance of such changes.

LIMITED TIME PROMOTION
Ready to set off for a flavourful cool treat at Changi Airport? Grab our limited edition popsicle "Changi Blossom", inspired by our unique Changi Scent. Carrying nodes of Jasmine Peach Oolong, refreshing Lemon Peel and soothing Chamomile, the popsicle is crafted to evoke the spirit of travel and adventure at Changi Airport.
Be sure to make this frozen treat a part of your memories at Changi Airport too! Summon your creative photography skills and take fun photos around the airport while enjoying the treat. Those who visit Changi Experience Studio (CES) can also snap a pic (or more) at a playful photo spot installation made just for popsicle fans.
Other popular flavours are also available, including Blue Sky Coconut, Malty Choco and Ice Cool Bandung.
MORE FUN AT CHANGI EXPERIENCE STUDIO
Enjoy an aviation-themed adventure at Changi Experience Studio as you learn all about Changi Airport through fun and games! Can you keep the airport running like clockwork? Try your hand at the games simulating various airport functions and discover fun facts you never knew about the airport.
Enjoy an aviation-themed adventure at Changi Experience Studio as you learn all about Changi Airport through fun and games! Can you keep the airport running like clockwork? Try your hand at the games simulating various airport functions and discover fun facts you never knew about the airport.
This SG60, head to Changi Experience Studio for exciting airport-themed games, fun photo spot and enjoy a refreshing icy treat!From now till 31 August 2025, purchase the Changi Rewards exclusive SG60 bundle that includes two attraction tickets and get two free popsicles on us! Limited to the first 200 bundles only.
How to redeem:
1. Purchase the SG60 bundle on Changi APP2. Visit Changi Experience Studio located on Level 4 of Jewel Changi Airport before 31 August 2025 to redeem attraction tickets and Changi Tower popsicles.

中文
About
Celebrate Singapore’s national flower at Terminal 3 with a 270 sqm floral garden from 21 July, featuring a seven-metre Vanda Miss Joaquim centerpiece and rare orchids like Dendrobium Changi Airport.
At Terminal 2, a six-metre floral Merlion created using 60 types of plants stands proudly by the Wonderfall, symbolising national pride and heritage. There are also floral displays featuring iconic local snacks like curry puffs that bring a sensory celebration of Singaporean identity.
Over at Jewel, over 1,200 red and white orchids will bloom from 1–31 August, including the special Dendrobium Jewel Changi Airport hybrid for Jewel’s 5th anniversary.

© 2025 Changi Airport
Let’s give you the best experience possible
Changi Airport uses cookies and other innovative tech to deliver an incredible and more personalized experience. Analytical technologies give us insights on site usage to improve our services. Marketing technologies (from changiairport.com and trusted partners) help us advertise our services more relevantly. If you choose tokeep them off, the basic functionality may degrade your experience. Preferences can be changed at any time with future effect. For more information, see ourprivacy policy.
